userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: I recommend to adults "You, me, or Adult ADD" it is tough and compassionate and it made me more comfortable with taking medication for ADHD, and convincing my partner to consider treating with medication.  The way I put it was "Are you going to try harder, harder this time to stay on top of things, or are you going to try a stimulant medication and see if using a stimulant medication works as well for you as it does for me?" The book gave me the vocabulary to better describe my diagnosis, and to better separate symptoms from personality.

userStories.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: Besides meds and other chemical treatments (like coffee), I find that having somebody check up on me to keep me on-task is helpful.

condition.description:
Is it hard for your child to sit still? Does your child act without thinking first? Does your child start but not finish things? If so, your child may have attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). Nearly everyone shows some of these behaviors at times, but ADHD lasts more than 6 months and causes problems in school, at home and in social situations.

ADHD is more common in boys than girls. It affects 3-5 percent of all American children.

The main features of ADHD are

  • Inattention
  • Hyperactivity
  • Impulsivity

No one knows exactly what causes ADHD. It sometimes runs in families, so genetics may be a factor. There may also be environmental factors.

A complete evaluation by a trained professional is the only way to know for sure if your child has ADHD. Treatment may include medicine to control symptoms, therapy, or both. Structure at home and at school is important. Parent training may also help.

NIH: National Institute of Mental Health

basics.bottom_line: Adderall is a first-choice treatment for ADHD that's available as a generic, but it's a stimulant, so it can cause insomnia and other side effects.
downsides: Has to be taken in the morning and early afternoon, otherwise it can cause insomnia.

Not safe for people with a history of heart problems.

description_processed.orig: Dextroamphetamine has a risk of abuse and dependence. Take only what's prescribed by a doctor to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. People with a history of drug abuse shouldn't take it.

risks_warnings.title: Aggressive behavior and psychosis
risks_warnings.description: Taking a stimulant like Dextroamphetamine can worsen or bring on psychiatric symptoms such as hallucinations, delusional thinking, and mania. It may also worsen or bring on aggressive behavior or hostility.

description_processed.orig: Taking a stimulant like Dextroamphetamine can worsen or bring on psychiatric symptoms such as hallucinations, delusional thinking, and mania. It may also worsen or bring on aggressive behavior or hostility.

risks_warnings.title: Long-term growth suppression
risks_warnings.description: Appetite suppression can occur. In clinical studies, long-term treatment with stimulants similar to Dextroamphetamine caused a temporary slowing of growth rate (both height and weight) in children who started the medication before they started puberty. Doctors should monitor children's growth during treatment.

description_processed.orig: Appetite suppression can occur. Doctors should monitor children's growth during treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Dextroamphetamine can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

description_processed.orig: Dextroamphetamine can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Dextroamphetamine can cause harm to your unborn baby and should only be used if the benefit is greater than the risk. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications and don't use if you're breastfeeding.

description_processed.orig: Dextroamphetamine can cause harm to your unborn baby and should only be used if the benefit is greater than the risk. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications and don't use if you're breastfeeding.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Taking Dextroamphetamine when you've recently stopped taking monoamine oxidase inhibitors within the last two weeks can cause your blood pressure to rise very high. Go to the emergency room or talk to your doctor immediately if you feel dizzy or faint or have an extremely bad headache.

description_processed.orig: Taking Dextroamphetamine when you've recently stopped taking monoamine oxidase inhibitors within the last two weeks can cause your blood pressure to rise very high. basics.benefits_moa: Focalin is a stimulant. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD, but it increases norepinephrine and dopamine activity in the brain, which affects attention and behavior.
basics.bottom_line: Focalin is a first-choice treatment for ADHD that's available as a generic, but it's a stimulant, so it can cause insomnia and other side effects.
downsides: Needs to be taken in the morning and early afternoon, or else it can cause insomnia later that night.
It's a controlled medication and should be locked up to prevent potential abuse.

downsides_processed.orig: Needs to be taken in the morning and early afternoon, or else it can cause insomnia later that night.

upsides: Focalin is used in combination with counseling or other non-drug therapies to treat ADHD.
Available as a generic medication.

Capsules can be opened and sprinkled in water or applesauce for people who don't like swallowing pills.

risks_warnings.title: Serious or life-threatening cardiovascular events
risks_warnings.description: Focalin has been associated with heart attack, stroke, and sudden death. Anyone with a history of heart problems shouldn't take it, and people should be screened for heart problems before starting it. Watch out for unexplained fainting or chest pain that comes on with physical activity.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD. It works in the brain and lowers the activity of certain stress hormones, but it's not a stimulant like many ADHD medicines.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a non-stimulant option to manage ADHD symptoms and behaviors, but it can lower your blood pressure.
downsides: Can lower blood pressure.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Can lower blood pressure.

You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Can be used alone or together with a stimulant-type medicine to treat ADHD.
In studies, it improved attention span and lowered hyperactivity and impulsivity in children and adolescents ages 6 to 17.
Also treats blood pressure and some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal (rebound hypertension)
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, and a sudden rise of blood pressure that can produce complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the supervision of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.

risks_warnings.title: Serious or life-threatening cardiovascular events
risks_warnings.description: Strattera has been associated with heart attack, stroke, and sudden death. Anyone with a history of heart problems shouldn't take it, and people should be screened for heart problems before starting it. Watch out for unexplained fainting or chest pain that comes on with physical activity.

description_processed.orig: Strattera has been associated with heart attack, stroke, and sudden death. Anyone with a history of heart problems shouldn't take it, and people should be screened for heart problems before starting it. Watch out for unexplained fainting or chest pain that comes on with physical activity.

risks_warnings.title: Aggressive behavior and psychosis
risks_warnings.description: Taking a stimulant like Strattera may worsen or bring on psychiatric symptoms such as hallucinations, delusional thinking, and mania. It may also worsen or bring on aggressive behavior or hostility.

description_processed.orig: Taking a stimulant like Strattera may worsen or bring on psychiatric symptoms such as hallucinations, delusional thinking, and mania. It may also worsen or bring on aggressive behavior or hostility.

risks_warnings.title: Prolonged erection
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of men having an erection lasting more than 4 hours while on Strattera. This has been rare. If not treated in time, this can cause permanent damage to your penis, including impotence. Talk to your doctor immediately or go to the emergency room if this happens.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of men having an erection lasting more than 4 hours while on Strattera. This has been rare. If not treated in time, this can cause permanent damage to your penis, including impotence. Talk to your doctor immediately or go to the emergency room if this happens.

risks_warnings.title: Problems with urination
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people having problems with urination while on Strattera. This has been rare. If you notice a feeling of incomplete emptying of your bladder while urinating, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people having problems with urination while on Strattera. This has been rare. If you notice a feeling of incomplete emptying of your bladder while urinating, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Long-term growth suppression
risks_warnings.description: Appetite suppression may occur. In clinical studies, long-term treatment with stimulants similar to Strattera caused a temporary slowing of growth rate (both height and weight) in children who started the medication before they started puberty. Doctors should monitor children's growth during treatment.

basics.benefits_moa: Vyvanse is an amphetamine stimulant. Researchers don't know exactly how it works for ADHD, but it increases norepinephrine and dopamine activity in the brain, which affects attention and behavior.
basics.bottom_line: Vyvanse is a first-choice treatment for ADHD and you only have to take it once a day. However, it's only available as brand name drug, so it can be expensive.
downsides: Has to be taken in the morning, otherwise it can cause insomnia later that night.
Not available as a generic medication, so it can be expensive.
It's a controlled medication and should be locked up to prevent potential abuse.
Not safe for people with a history of heart problems.

The capsule can be taken whole, or opened into a glass of water or orange juice, or swallowed in a spoonful of yogurt.

carousel_items: Usually taken together with other medicines for better blood pressure control.
Can cause drowsiness, headache, dizziness, and dry mouth.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
If side effects don't go away, talk to your doctor about alternatives.
The weekly patch form can have fewer side effects.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
Extended release tablet also used to treat ADHD.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonidine is an alpha-2 agonist. It works in the brain to tell your blood vessels to relax, and it lowers the activity of certain stress hormones. This lowers blood pressure.
basics.bottom_line: Clonidine is a good addition if you need more than one medicine to control your blood pressure, but it has a lot of side effects. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Has a lot of side effects compared to other blood pressure-lowering medicine because it works in the brain.
The pill form can make some people sleepy, dizzy, and have dry mouth.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Has a lot of side effects compared to other blood pressure-lowering medicine because it works in the brain.

upsides: Can be added to other blood pressure-lowering medicines if you need additional blood pressure control.

Works in the brain, so it can help treat some nervous system and psychiatric conditions.
Under the brand name Kapvay, it's used to treat ADHD in children and teenagers.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, or have a sudden rise of blood pressure that can result in complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the guidance of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonidine suddenly can cause agitation, headache, tremors, or have a sudden rise of blood pressure that can result in complications. Clonidine should be stopped over 2-4 days with the guidance of a doctor. If using with a beta blocker medicine, slowly stop the beta blocker first before stopping Clonidine.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.title: Low heart rate (bradycardia)
risks_warnings.description: Clonidine can lower your heart rate too much. Talk to your doctor if you continue to feel dizzy, tired or getting out  of breath doing things you normally can do after using Clonidine for a week.
risk_factors: Using other medicine(s) that slows the heart

carousel_items: Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
You can take the extended-release form once a day with food either in the morning or in the evening at about the same time each day.
Extended-release capsules should be swallowed whole. If you can’t swallow pills, open the capsule, sprinkle it on a spoonful of applesauce and then swallow it without chewing.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

basics.benefits_moa: Venlafaxine is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Venlafaxine is good for treating depression and anxiety. May work when other antidepressants haven't, it's but more likely to cause side effects and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Overdosing on this medication could be fatal.
It's more likely to cause nausea and vomiting or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants. Also causes more sleepiness than others.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Venlafaxine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Venlafaxine suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

carousel_items: Needs to be taken every day for 1 to 2 weeks to start feeling better, and for 6 to 8 weeks to see the full effect of the medication.
It's important to keep taking Nortriptyline even when you feel your symptoms are getting better.
Take it with food and/or at bedtime to decrease the potential side effects.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
If you decide to stop taking Nortriptyline, work with your doctor to slowly get off this medicine to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Nortriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). It helps improve your mood by altering the levels of serotonin, norepinephrine, and other similar chemicals in your brain.
basics.bottom_line: Nortriptyline is a good option for treating depression, especially for people who also have problems with persistent nerve pain.
downsides: Side effects are usually manageable, but can be annoying.
Increases the risk of falls, especially when used in the elderly.
There's an increased chance of it causing heart problems, especially in people with a history of heart problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Side effects are usually manageable, but can be annoying.
Increases the risk of falls, especially when used in the elderly.
There's an increased chance of it causing heart problems, especially in people with a history of heart problems.

upsides: Helpful with treating certain types of pain, like migraines or nerve-related pain.
Generally well tolerated and has fewer side effects than other medicines in the same class of drugs.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline commonly cause a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. Be careful since you can feel dizzy or fall. If symptoms continues for more than a week, you may need to change the dose or medicine.

basics.benefits_moa: Provigil is a stimulant that helps you feel awake. Researchers don't know exactly how Provigil works, but it probably affects chemicals (neurotransmitters) in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Provigil is effective in improving alertness, but it can interact with other medicines and shouldn't be used long-term.
downsides: Provigil can be habit-forming, so it's typically not used for long-term treatment.
Interacts with many other medications.
Taking Provigil will make hormonal birth control less effective. You should definitely use additional forms of non-hormonal contraception.
Not a good choice if you have liver or kidney problems.

basics.benefits_moa: Tenex is a centrally-acting alpha agonist medication. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart rate and relaxing the blood vessels. It's not clear how Tenex works in ADHD, but it's used when stimulants haven't worked or can't be used in people.
basics.bottom_line: Tenex can be used to treat both blood pressure and ADHD, but it's not recommended as a first-line treatment for either problem.
downsides: Doesn't control ADHD as well as stimulants do, so it's used as a second-line medication.
Not a preferred drug to control blood pressure.
Can't be stopped suddenly, especially for blood pressure, since the blood pressure can dramatically increase.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: I recommend to adults "You, me, or Adult ADD" it is tough and compassionate and it made me more comfortable with taking medication for ADHD, and convincing my partner to consider treating with medication.  The way I put it was "Are you going to try harder, harder this time to stay on top of things, or are you going to try a stimulant medication and see if using a stimulant medication works as well for you as it does for me?" The book gave me the vocabulary to better describe my diagnosis, and to better separate symptoms from personality.

surveys.question: What’s your best coping strategy?
surveys.tip: Besides meds and other chemical treatments (like coffee), I find that having somebody check up on me to keep me on-task is helpful.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Be sure to drink lots of water, and eat calorie-rich foods like peanut butter, meats, and milk, because stimulants can have profound effects on the metabolism! I lost a lot of weight quite by accident and if you're still young, that might be dangerous.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: You will get a sense of clarity in the beginning but it will level off because you've adjusted to it. It may feel like it doesn't work anymore - but it is. Don't quit it.

surveys.tip: I was diagnosed with combined type Adhd as a Child but my parents believed in discipline instead of medication. After age 24 I had a 4 years old and it hit me. How can I take care of my baby she needs stability and security in her life and let me tell you what it felt like a light build was plugged in for the first time and the world made sense. I went to college had a 3..87 gpa met my husband we bought a house? I have never committed to anything because I would get bored and walk away it really opens your eyes and is the best thing I have ever done for my baby and our family
